intro: Sedella leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded sedella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often with a striking coloration. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Sedella leiocarpa is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
